Module hu.unipannon.virt.plot
Package hu.unipannon.virt.plot.util

Class FunctionGenerator

  • java.lang.Object
    • hu.unipannon.virt.plot.util.FunctionGenerator
  • public class FunctionGenerator
extends java.lang.Object
    The FunctionGenerator class generates an array of x and y coordinates that can make up a function. The domain of the function and the mapping rule of the function can be suppplied via a fluent interface. Then the x and y arrays can be queried with the getXs() and getYs() function to be used in a lineplot.
    By default the generator uses 100 sampling points, equivalent to MATLAB's linspace function. Example:
    
   var fun = FunctionGenerator.function()
             .startValue(0.0)
             .endValue(2.0 * Math.PI)
             .mapping(x -> Math.sin(x))
             .makeFunction();
    Author:
    Tóth Bálint

        public FunctionGenerator startValue​(double startValue)
        Setter for the starter value of the interval. Given value must be less then the end value.

        Returns:
        itself.

      • endValue

        public FunctionGenerator endValue​(double endValue)
        Setter for the end value of the interval. Given value must be greater then the start value.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        itself.
